titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to revise the rules under the military Survivor Benefit Plan for termination of an annuity paid to a surviving spouse upon remarriage before age 55.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

bill.summary: 5/10/2001--Introduced. Amends Federal provisions concerning the military Survivor Benefit Plan to state that the annuity of a surviving spouse shall not be terminated if the spouse and member were married for at least ten years during which such member performed active or reserve duty and the former spouse remarries before age 55.Applies such exception to annuities terminated before the enactment of this Act.
